lines.text: I live here. That's my home, such as it is.
[Ala Bahma rudely smears a pie on Bugs' face]

[to the audience]
Of course you realize this means war!
And now from the empty hat I will prestigajagoo... proostiga... prastigatijay... pull a live rabbit. Yes. Rootah, Vootah, Zoot! And observe, a rabbit! Yes.
[Pulls a carrot instead; audience laughs]
[last lines]
If I dood it, I get a whippin'. I dood it!
[Bugs hits Bahma in face with pie]

[singing]
Aloha Oe, farewell to thee...
[first lines]
Eh, pardon me, doc. Fresh out of carrots.
Uh, do you like blacksberries pie?

[shakes his head]
No, no... did you say blackberry pie?
[Ala Bahma nods]
Yum. Yummy.
[Ala Bahma pulls a hanky, places it on his palm, pulls it to reveal a pie]
Well, have some!
[Ala Bahma smears the pie on Bugs' face]

[chuckling nastily]
Ha-ha-ha! Ho-ho-ho! What a dumb bunny! Ha-ha-ha!
[Ala Bahma leaves]

[to the audience]
Of course you realize this means war!
Let's see now. Uh, you was trying to prestigogiga... prestadagigoo... pro presta... pull a rabbit out of the hat. Regardez!
[Bugs dives into the hat]
Rootah, Vootah, Zoot!
[He pulls himself from the hat by the ears and takes several bows]
Look, Doc. Do I go around nailing signs over your house? Do I? There's still such a thing as private property, you know. Did you ever hear about the inalienable right of the sanctity of the home?
